intro: Erigeron tonsus, commonly known as blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its blue to purple flowers bloom in the summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Erigeron tonsus is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and meadows.
